Author: ngunguru
Text: Mine has this feature but when it sends the numbers to my app the variance is pretty wild. Recently it hasn't been working at all (other than giving the weight) which doesn't bother me because it was clearly bullshit. So I would not bother paying the extra if I were making the decision again.

Author: SemicolonButterfly
Text: The ones that report body fat % do it by sending an electrical current from one foot to the other via your lower body. Generally, they're not considered accurate (I've heard they maybe get within 5%, which is useless in my mind).  I have a fitbit Aria scale that offers this feature, and I definitely do not trust the body fat % number. I got a second bf% estimate using the navy equation and the results were very different. All the bf% on the scale does is upset me so I usually step off before it has a chance to do the body fat % estimate.
